comments:
Running with the Iteration 2 test pass build from 10-09.

If I start the "old" AC from Iteration 1, my URL tests run to completion.

Running the Iteration 2 AC, most tests fail to run on BOTH Windows and Linux (new AC) either with local host or as a remote agent.  Occassionally a test will complete.  The consistent behavior on Windows and Linux provides added confirmation of the problem.  URL test execution remains blocked in Iteration 2.

Ali and Valentina also reported similar problems with URL tests on the same build.

I get a consistent repeatable failure on my Windows machine when using the IAC where there is a timeout followed by an InactiveProcessException. Nobody else seems to be seeing this problem.

I will add more information as it becomes available.
Which i1 build were you using for what you referred to as "old" AC?
Sounds like bug 158872, assigning to Thay, copying Samson.

The folder that the "old" ac is in is dated 9/11 while most of the files in the install are dated 9/7.  It was the install I used for the final iteration 1 test pass.  Is there a way to identify the AC build number from the install?

As added info, I am running IBM JVM 1.5 SR2.

Please change the priority to P1.  I don't have the permissions for that change.
Can we increase the priority to P1?

Solaris URL test execution is also blocked.

Using the Iteration 2 test pass build for the AC on Solaris as an agent (tptpdc.solaris_sparc-TPTP-4.3.0-200610090100.zip),  I get the following messages into the console window when trying to run a URL Test:

On the Windows host machine when this happens, I get a modal error dialog, "IWAT4039E The Test Execution Harness reported the following problems:An established connection was aborted by the software in your host machine."  The result is the same if I run the AC on the host or utilize the IAC.

Z/OS URL test execution is also blocked.

Using the Iteration 2 test pass build for the AC on Z/OS as an agent, I get the same hang near the beginning of test exection on the agent that I am getting for Windows and Linux.  I do not get the errors noted on Solaris.

Could you please provide a test case that I could run to reproduce this problem.

Thanks
Sorry Karla I accidentally reassigned it to you when I hit the commit button.  You can assign it back to me.
Setting Priority and target, and reassigning to Thay.

Created an attachment (id=51924)
testsuite to reproduce problem

As far as a test case, pretty much any URL test will do.  I am attaching a testsuite that I have been using.  It always runs to completion perfectly on an Iteration 1 AC and most of the time hangs or does not start on all platforms I have tested.
DuWayne has informed me that he believes this problem is with his runner code within the AC.  Reassigning back to DuWayne.

The referenced defect is no longer considered a blocker.

I investigated further, it turns out that all the tests I was trying were from chunk encoded server responses, with the problems reported by others helping to convince me it was the AC in addition to running fine against the old "AC".

So, most of the problem is actually mine.  However, the problem with Solaris still looks like a real problem.  To avoid confusion, I will see if we can get independent confirmation of the Solaris problem and file a Solaris only AC defect.

The problem with not being able to execute against the IAC (InactiveProcessException) seems to be unique to my machine so far, although I would still like to nail down that issue.

 As luck would have it, in the process of working on a different defect, I have a fix for this problem that only needs some added testing before checkin.  I would like permission to deliver the fix this afternoon (before I go on vacation), since the fix is only in a single source file and it only affects URL Test execution.

Changing severity from blocker to critical.  I have a tested fix ready for delivery when I can get permission to checkin.  It is limited to a single source file and only affects URL Test Execution against a server that responds with chunk encoded data.

I am getting the same error dialog on my local Windows machine:  "IWAT4039E The Test Execution Harness reported the following problems:An established connection was aborted by the software in your host machine" when running Junit tests with Solaris as my remote host. This occurs each time when the tests are at 66%. I am also using the i2 test pass build from 10-09.
DuWayne, could you clarify whether your patch mentioned above fixes the Solaris problem.
No need to clarify, it turns out my problem was specific to the Solaris server we were testing on and has been resolved.
Please target to 4.4 since all non-blocking/critical defects will be deferred as decided in today's AG call.

Changing to critical.  This is a regression.  Had previously inadvertently changed from blocking to major, should have been set to critical.  Per discussion in today's TPTP Test Tools Project Weekly Meeting, will be requesting to fix this defect.

The fix has been tested, is contained in a single source file, and only affects URL test execution against a chunk encoded server response.  I will be entering a test case to cover this problem.

Fixed 10/24/06 in HttpRequestHandler.java.  Will add/modify test cases Wednesday (10/25).  Found and corrected additional problems yesterday and today during testing.  Wanted to get this in today to test with a real build as soon as possible, since it is runner code and affects proper URL testing on all agent configurations. I will mark it as FIXED after adding test cases.

In HttpRequestHandler.java, fixed a problem seen in further URL execution testing that caused errors and could cause a hang due to Integer.parseInt NumberFormatException. Still planning to add test cases today and mark this defect as fixed.
Fixed as noted above, adding test cases today.
ACTION: Please verify/close this defect.
Verified in TPTP-4.3.0-200611160100.
closing.
